summary: George Edward Wright is mentioned in several CIA documents related to Black militants and hijackers in the early 1970s. He is identified as a Black Panther member who traveled from Algiers to Paris. While in Paris, he and other Black Panther members were reportedly receiving support from Henri Curiel's organization to obtain plastic surgery and false documentation for re-entry into the U.S. The CIA requested photos to aid in their identification. Other documents mention the movements and activities of other Black Panther Party members, suggesting Wright was part of a network of individuals involved in revolutionary activities and seeking to evade authorities.
significance: Based on the provided documents, George Edward Wright's significance is related to his involvement with the Black Panther Party and his activities related to potential hijacking and revolutionary actions. There is no direct connection to the JFK assassination mentioned in these documents.
